image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Tom Homan's first statement after Trump's 'Border Czar' announcement: 'I don't care...'
item.description: Called the father of 'family separation', Tom Homan will be the 'Border Czar' of the Trump administration. He said he doesn't care about what people think about his strict policy on illegal immigrants. "I’ve got to go back and help because every morning… I’m pissed off with what this [Biden] administration did to the most secure border in my lifetime," Homan said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Sean Diddy advised this to young children on Rosie O'Donnell show. Old video viral
item.description: In the 1997 episode, Rosie asked Diddy about his success. "We feel blessed, we thank God for everything. We constantly pray and know that he's responsible for everything that has been blessed and granted to us," Diddy said. "That's what we try to tell young kids, that it's important to have God in your life." The Youtube video is going viral as Diddy is accused of raping minors.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Voting for John Thune is indefensible': MAGA cautious ahead of Senate leadership election
item.description: The Senate Majority leadership election is scheduled for Wednesday, with Republicans holding a 53-46 majority. While Trump hasn't endorsed a candidate, MAGA supporters are rallying behind Rick Scott, criticizing Thune and Cornyn for their past anti-Trump stances. Elon Musk has meanwhile endorsed Scott as the Senate leader. A list is going viral indicating Senator Ted Cruz's support for Thune.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ivory coast road accident: Deadly collision claims 21 lives, injures 11
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tom Homan's old spat video with AOC viral after Trump picks him as Border Czar
item.description: ​Called the father of family separation in immigration policies, Tom Homan was reportedly a contributor to Project 2025 from which Donald Trump distanced himself and said he did not know who were the people behind Project 2025. Once Tom Homan told Pramila Jayapal, "You work for me. I am a taxpayer."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Usha Vance's grandfather's Telugu accent made IIT students fall in love with him
item.description: IIT alumni worldwide are celebrating Usha Chilukuri, granddaughter of esteemed IIT professor Rama Sastri, as she becomes the first Indian American Second Lady of the US. Known for his Telugu-accented English and dedicated teaching, Rama Sastri left a legacy in IIT lore, from humorous mess fee debates to a transformative MIT stint. Usha, Yale and Cambridge-educated, embodies this legacy, marrying JD Vance, Trump’s running mate. This milestone connects IIT’s academic heritage with the pinnacle of American politics.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'What the hell is wrong with Michael Strahan': Backlash for hand gesture on Veterans Day
item.description: Michael Strahan is facing criticism for not placing his hand over his heart during the national anthem at a Veterans Day tribute event. The Fox Sports analyst, whose father served in the Army, stood with his hands clasped in front of him. "@michaelstrahan you should be absolutely ASHAMED of yourself disrespecting these men and women! You owe everyone an apology..." one user wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' former staff has this WILD idea to make her first female president: 'Biden must...'
item.description: The former Kamala Harris staff thinks Democrats should do something crazy before January 6. ​"Dems have better policies but we must realize the old rules no longer apply. We are not playing table tennis. We are in a mixed martial arts fight and Americans respond to drama and excitement. We should use that to make our arguments for a better path forward," Jamal Simmons added.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Not my job to...' : Meghan Markle's seven-word response when confronted over bullying
item.description: Meghan Markle, the Duchess of Sussex, allegedly faced accusations of harsh treatment towards palace staff, as claimed by royal biographer Robert Lacey. Lacey's book reveals allegations of Meghan's demanding behavior and a tense work environment. Meghan refuted these claims, suggesting they were part of a smear campaign, while her friends defended her character.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Barron Trump played key role in his father's victory
item.description: Donald Trump's son, Barron Trump, played a significant role in his father's recent election victory. Lara Trump revealed Barron's behind-the-scenes contributions, highlighting his strategic suggestions for securing votes. Notably, Barron advised his father to engage with young audiences through podcasts, leading to successful interviews with internet personalities like Adin Ross.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: MATGA: Meet the women who want to make poisoning men great again after Trump victory
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When NYU friends asked Barron Trump who he voted for he says he doesn't ...
item.description: Barron Trump, son of former President Donald Trump, has reportedly surprised his NYU peers by declining to reveal his political stance, stating he "doesn't support any party." Despite this, sources close to the family suggest Barron played a key role in his father's 2024 campaign, particularly in connecting him with influential podcasters to reach a younger demographic.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Rick Scott, GOP Senator endorsed by Elon Musk for Senate majority leader
item.description: Elon Musk has endorsed Republican Senator Rick Scott for Senate majority leader. Scott is vying for the position against Senators John Thune and John Cornyn. Trump stated that any Republican Senator seeking the leadership position must agree to recess appointments. Scott agreed and pledged to get Trump's nominations through quickly.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian American Democratic fundraiser receives racist messages
item.description: Ajay Jain Bhutoria, an Indian American and Democratic Party fundraiser, has been targeted with racist and threatening messages urging him to return to India. The messages, sent from an unknown number, accused Bhutoria of prioritizing Indian interests over American ones.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump slams Democrats for involving Liz Cheney in 2024 election campaign
item.description: Former President Donald Trump criticised the Democratic Party for involving former Republican Representative Liz Cheney and her father, Dick Cheney, in their 2024 campaign. Trump believes their involvement will negatively impact the Democrats and that bringing "losers" into a campaign is unwise. He also referred to Liz Cheney as a "war hawk" for her past support of military intervention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Twin earthquakes shake Cuba in wake of recent hurricanes, blackouts
item.description: Two strong earthquakes, registering magnitudes of 5.9 and 6.8, struck off the coast of southern Cuba, causing panic and damage to buildings and infrastructure. The quakes occurred just days after Hurricanes Rafael and Oscar impacted the island, compounding the difficulties faced by residents already grappling with power outages and an economic crisis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump pressures candidates for Senate GOP leader to allow ‘recess appointments’
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump urged the next Senate Republican leader to back the use of "recess appointments" to expedite Cabinet confirmations. Trump emphasized the need to fill positions swiftly and prevent delays similar to his first term. The three candidates vying for the leadership position expressed openness to Trump's suggestion, highlighting the significance of his endorsement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan Railways suspends train services to and from Quetta station after explosion
item.description: Following a deadly explosion at Quetta railway station that claimed 26 lives and injured 62, Pakistan Railways has suspended train services to and from the station until November 14th. The blast occurred during the departure of the Jaffar Express, with numerous passengers present.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump has said he won’t be a dictator ‘except for Day 1’: A look at his to-do list
item.description: Upon a potential return to the White House, Donald Trump has outlined a series of immediate actions for his first day and second term. These include dismissing legal cases against him, enacting mass deportations of undocumented immigrants, pardoning those involved in the January 6th Capitol riot, and dismantling the perceived "deep state.

item.title: Who gets to keep the ring if engagement’s off? US court rules always the buyer
item.description: A Massachusetts court ruled that a man is entitled to the return of a $70,000 engagement ring he gave his former fiancée. The ruling overturns a decades-old precedent that required judges to determine who was at fault for the breakup in such cases.
